data.title: The Best 'Nashville' Seasons, Ranked
data.meta_description: Nashville has captured the hearts of many with its compelling storytelling, unforgettable characters, and the melodious backdrop of country music. Starring ...
data.text:
Aired: September 24, 2014 - May 13, 2015

Juliette's pregnancy brings with it some major complications. Meanwhile, Rayna has called off her wedding and is trying to dissolve a contract she finds undesirable. More faces from the past turn up, and it's another season od mischief and mayhem in Nashville.

Major episodes this season include "I Feel Sorry for Me," "Nobody Said It Was Going to Be Easy," and “I'm Not That Good at Goodbye.”

Key Moments:

The live first-episode performances.

Juliette's convincing audition.

The flatline at the end of the season.

Why It's A Standout Season:

Season 3 of Nashville ramps up the drama and brings a plethora of emotional highs and lows. Juliette's pregnancy is fraught with complications, and Rayna's quest to dissolve an unsavory contract adds tension. This season is beloved for its intense, unforgettable twists and deeply emotional story arcs.

Aired: September 25, 2013 - May 14, 2014

Rayna wakes up from a coma after a car crash and Juliette finds a new rival in Layla. Meanwhile, Teddy and Rayna have divorced, and Teddy has eyes on another woman.

Interesting episodes this season include "You're No Angel Yourself," "She's Got You," and "It's All Wrong, But It's Right."

Key Moments:

Peggy's miscarriage.

An assassination attempt on Teddy.

Scarlett's boo-laden performance.

Why It's A Standout Season:

Season 2 picks up with Rayna waking from a coma and Juliette clashing with new rival Layla. The drama intensifies with key moments like Peggy’s heartbreaking miscarriage, the assassination attempt on Teddy, and Scarlett’s hapless performance. Fans love Season 2 for its relentless drama and the deepening of character relationships and conflicts.

Aired: October 10, 2012 - May 22, 2013

Rayna Jaymes, a fading country star, and Juliette Barnes, an up-and-coming singer, become rivals. Rayna's husband is running for mayor of Nashville, and Juliette goes through some snags on the road to her dreams.

Major episodes include "We Live in Two Different Worlds," "Lovesick Blues," and "You Win Again."

Key Moments:

Teddy admitting his embezzlement to Rayna.

Juliette is arrested for shoplifting.

Juliette finds Dante and her mother dead.

Why It's A Standout Season:

The debut season introduces us to the tumultuous lives of Rayna Jaymes and Juliette Barnes. As Rayna’s star wanes and Juliette’s rises, their rivalry becomes a central focus. This season is celebrated for laying the foundation of the show’s intricate plotlines and deep character dynamics.

Aired: September 23, 2015 - May 25, 2016

Deacon and Beverly are both in testing conditions at the hospital, the latter being in a coma. Juliette is dealing with postpartum depression. The record label also has to deal with the results of Will coming out as gay.

Key episodes this season include "Till the Pain Outwears the Shame," "The Slender Threads That Bind Us Here," and "Unguarded Moments."

Key Moments:

Beverly is taken off life support.

Luke is told he owes $40 million in taxes.

Hayden Panettiere's real-life postpartum depression is written into the script.

Why It's A Standout Season:

Season 4 opens with Deacon and Beverly in precarious hospital conditions and Juliette grappling with postpartum depression. Key moments include Beverly being taken off life support, Luke’s $40 million tax bombshell, and Hayden Panettiere’s real-life postpartum struggles woven into the script. This season strikes a chord with viewers for its heartfelt exploration of mental health and family dynamics.

Aired: December 19, 2017 - July 26, 2018

The sixth and final season of Nashville brings all the drama you'd expect: family strife, political shenanigans, drug overdoses, and custody battles… and that's just the beginning. Oh, and if you thought that Nashville would be the last show on Earth to break the fourth wall, you've got another thing coming in the series finale.

Key episodes this season include “Beyond the Sunset,” “Pick Yourself Up,” and “Jump Then Fall.”

Key Moments:

Juliette gets booed off stage.

Will suffers an overdose.

The fourth-wall-breaking series finale.

Why It's A Standout Season:

The sixth and final season encapsulates all the drama and emotional weight fans have come to love. This season ties up loose ends while introducing new challenges, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats. Season 6 wraps up the series with a poignant farewell, celebrating the show’s legacy with dramatic flair and heartfelt resolutions.

Aired: December 15, 2016 - August 10, 2017

This is the first season of Nashville that aired on CMT instead of ABC. The drama escalates as both Juliette and Rayna deal with horrible accidents. The show also brought in famous guest stars like Rachel Bilson, Carla Gugino, and Bridgit Mendler.

Key episodes this season include “The Wayfaring Stranger,” “Love Hurts,” and “Reasons to Quit.”

Key Moments:

Juliette is paralyzed in a plane crash.

Rayna gets into another devastating car accident.

Scarlett deals with rabid tabloid journalism.

Why It's A Standout Season:

Season 5 marks the show’s transition to CMT and amps up the dramatic stakes. Standout moments include Juliette’s paralysis from a plane crash, Rayna’s devastating car accident, and Scarlett’s battles with tabloid journalism. The presence of guest stars like Rachel Bilson and Carla Gugino adds star power, making this season a fan favorite for its gripping narrative and fresh dynamics.
